instruction: [INST] Analyze this file to learn MacBook motherboard repair. The 'definitions' section explains key technical terms. The 'threads' section contains real-world repair discussions. Use both sections to understand and learn how to troubleshoot MacBook issues. Posts from username 'larossmann' , 'dukefawks' , and '2informaticos' are posts from trusted experts.[/INST]

definitions.A2179: What is A2179? A2179 is a model number for a 13 inch size MacBook Air from years Early 2020 with EMC 3302, that may contain one of these boards depending on the year & configuration: 820-01958..
definitions.P5VG3S_EN: What is P5VG3S_EN? This signal enables the PP5V_G3S power rail when it is high. Signals with _EN on the end enable whatever came before the _EN if the signal is high. .
definitions.PP3V3_G3S: What is PP3V3_G3S? PP3V3_G3S is a 3.3v power rail present when the machine is in a G3S standby state. .
definitions.P3V3G3S_EN: What is P3V3G3S_EN? P3VG3S_EN is a signal that turns on the PP3V3_G3S power rail. Signals with _EN on the end enable whatever came before the _EN if the signal is high. .

threads.title: MacBook Air <MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER>A2179</MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER> dead
threads.message:
Good friends, here again, I have this equipment that suddenly turned off and did not turn on again. It has no liquid damage.

Doesn't recognize in DFU mode

And the input voltage attached photo

any ideas?  thank so much

threads.title: MacBook Air <MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER>A2179</MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER> dead
threads.message:
20V/0.05A with battery connected?
Is it recognized in DFU mode?
Do you get all G3S voltages?

threads.title: MacBook Air <MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER>A2179</MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER> dead
threads.message:
yes with battery
I have tried several times, cables etc in case I was wrong in the process and I have not achieved DFU. 

Voltages:

<SIGNAL>P1V8G3S_DSCHG_EN</SIGNAL> = 0v
P1V8G3S_DSCHG_EN_ = 3,1v (sometimes 3,1 change 2,2 , 3,1 2,2 and after a few minutes stable at 3.1
<SIGNAL>P1V8G3S_EN</SIGNAL>= 0v
<SIGNAL>P1V8G3S_SS</SIGNAL> = 0v
<SIGNAL>P3V3G3S_EN</SIGNAL>= 0v
<SIGNAL>P3V3G3S_SS</SIGNAL> = 0v
<SIGNAL>P5VG3S_EN</SIGNAL> = 0v
<SIGNAL>P5VG3S_SW</SIGNAL> = 0v
<SIGNAL>PP3V3_G3S</SIGNAL> = 0v


etc...

I have been able to verify a slight heat in the IC T2 while it was connected for checks

threads.message: Input ports stay at 5V, if no battery connected?
